title: 79/315. The Wiphala for living well in harmony, balance and complementarity with Mother Earth
text:
United Nations 
A/RES/79/315
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: General 
2 July 2025 
25-10887 (E) 
*2510887* 
 
 
Seventy-ninth session 
Agenda item 14 
Culture of peace 
 
 
 
 
 Resolution adopted by the General Assembly 
on 30 June 2025 
 
 
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/79/L.95)] 
 
 
 79/315. The Wiphala for living well in harmony, balance and 
complementarity with Mother Earth 
 
 
 
The General Assembly, 
 
Reaffirming the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations, 
 
Reaffirming also the Universal Declaration of Human Rights1 and the Declaration 
and Programme of Action on a Culture of Peace, 2 and recalling the United Nations 
Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples 3  and the Convention on the 
Protection and Promotion of the Diversity of Cultural Expressions adopted by the 
United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization 4 as applicable to 
Member States that are Parties to that Convention, 
 
Acknowledging the Wiphala, which reflects the multicoloured rainbow, 
composed of seven colours harmoniously arranged in a geometric grid pattern, 
inspired by the order, harmony and beauty of Nature, originating from and used by 
some Indigenous Peoples and some other social groups and organizations and adopted 
in a number of countries in their resistance against colonialism, demands for 
brotherhood and sisterhood, peace and international unity, and as an affirmation of 
living in harmony, balance and complementarity among all living beings on Mother 
Earth, 
 
Taking into account that, for those who raise the Wiphala, it embodies a unity 
of values and ways of life grounded in respect for life and aligned with the principles 
of freedom, justice, democracy, tolerance, solidarity, cooperation, pluralism, cultural 
diversity, dialogue and understanding at all levels of society and among nations, 
_______________ 
 
1 Resolution 217 A (III). 
 
2 Resolutions 53/243 A and B. 
 
3 Resolution 61/295. 
 
4 United Nations, Treaty Series, vol. 2440, No. 43977. 

A/RES/79/315 
The Wiphala for living well in harmony, balance and 
complementarity with Mother Earth
 
25-10887
2/2 
 
 
1. 
Recalls Indigenous Peoples’ rights, as recognized in the United Nations 
Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples, to practise and revitalize their 
cultural traditions and customs, which includes the right to maintain, protect and 
develop the past, present and future manifestations of their cultures, as well as the 
right to maintain, control, protect and develop their cultural heritage, traditional 
knowledge and traditional cultural expressions, including their sciences and 
technologies; 
 
2. 
Invites Member States to promote the appreciation of and respect for all 
cultures, noting the Wiphala as a manifestation by which certain Indigenous Peoples 
reaffirm their identity, unity and values, and safeguard their cultural heritage and 
traditional knowledge, and as an expression of living well in harmony, balance and 
complementarity with Mother Earth, to be displayed in public, educational and 
institutional spaces, as appropriate; 
 
3. 
Calls upon the international community to advance in the understanding, 
tolerance and solidarity among all peoples and cultures, and to strengthen efforts to 
eradicate manifestations of racism, racial discrimination, xenophobia and related 
intolerance, including against Indigenous Peoples, and promote respect for the 
diversity of their cultural manifestations, traditions, practices and knowledge systems. 
 
81st plenary meeting 
30 June 2025
